targets.expr:
# min by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by (pod) (min by(pod, container) (min_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{job="kube-state-metrics", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))) / sum by (pod) (kube_pod_container_info{job="kube-state-metrics", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"})

# sum without(container) fixes issues if job labels has changed
max by (pod) (sum without(container) (last_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="cpu"}[$__range])))

max by(pod) (avg_over_time(node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_irate{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__range]) / on(pod, container) group_left kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="cpu"})

# sum without(container) fixes issues if job labels has changed
max by (pod) (sum without(container) (last_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="cpu"}[$__range])))

max by(pod) (avg_over_time(node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_irate{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__range]) / on(pod, container) group_left kube_pod_container_resource_limits{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="cpu"})

sum by (pod) (last_over_time(container_memory_rss{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__range])) / sum  by (pod) (last_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="memory"}[$__range]))

sum(last_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__range])) by (pod) / sum(last_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="memory"}[$__range])) by (pod)

options.content:
- Raw usage = RSS + Cache
- RSS is actually allocated memory
- Cache = Active + Inactive file
- WSS = Raw usage - Inactive file = RSS + Active file

What to look for:
- WSS reaching limit causes file garbage collection
- RSS reaching limit causes OOM

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by (pod) (max by(pod, container) (max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="memory"}[$__interval])))

# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by (pod) (max by(pod, container) (max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", resource="memory"}[$__interval])))

# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by (pod) (max by(pod, container) (max_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])))

# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by (pod) (max by(pod, container) (max_over_time(container_memory_rss{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_total{container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]) + rate(container_fs_writes_total{container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]) + rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))

options.content:
Read/write from NFS and SMB shares
will not be shown in the storage throughput.

Cadvisor exports data from cgroup io.stats,
which are only calculated for block devices.

targets.expr: sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]) + rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))
